green_teas.name: Sencha
green_teas.description: Most popular Japanese green tea with grassy, sweet flavor
green_teas.instructions: Heat water to 160-170°F, add tea leaves to teapot or cup, pour water over leaves, steep for 1-2 minutes, strain and serve immediately

green_teas.name: Gyokuro
green_teas.description: Premium shade-grown Japanese tea with sweet, umami-rich flavor
green_teas.instructions: Use cooler water to preserve delicate flavors, add leaves to small teapot, pour water over leaves, steep for 2-3 minutes, can re-steep 2-3 times

green_teas.name: Matcha
green_teas.description: Finely ground powder of shade-grown tea leaves, whisked into water
green_teas.instructions: Sift matcha powder into bowl to remove clumps, add small amount of hot water, whisk vigorously in M or W pattern until frothy, add remaining water if making usucha (thin tea)

green_teas.name: Longjing (Dragon Well)
green_teas.description: Famous Chinese green tea with flat leaves and sweet, nutty flavor
green_teas.instructions: Rinse leaves briefly with hot water, discard rinse water, add fresh hot water, steep for 2-3 minutes, can re-steep multiple times

green_teas.name: Gunpowder
green_teas.description: Rolled into small pellets, strong and slightly smoky flavor
green_teas.instructions: Add pellets to teapot, pour hot water over leaves, steep for 2-3 minutes, traditionally used in Moroccan mint tea

green_teas.name: Genmaicha
green_teas.description: Green tea mixed with roasted brown rice, nutty and toasty
green_teas.instructions: Add tea and rice mixture to teapot, pour hot water over, steep for 2-3 minutes, strain and enjoy the nutty aroma

green_teas.name: Hojicha
green_teas.description: Roasted green tea with reddish-brown color and smoky flavor
green_teas.instructions: Add roasted leaves to teapot, pour hot water over leaves, steep for 30-60 seconds only, low in caffeine making it good for evening

green_teas.name: Kukicha (Twig Tea)
green_teas.description: Made from stems and twigs, mild and slightly sweet
green_teas.instructions: Add twigs to teapot, pour hot water over, steep for 1-2 minutes, very low in caffeine and gentle on stomach

green_teas.name: Bi Luo Chun
green_teas.description: Delicate spiral-shaped leaves with fruity, floral notes
green_teas.instructions: Use glass teapot to appreciate the dancing leaves, add leaves first, pour water gently, steep for 2-3 minutes

green_teas.name: Mao Feng
green_teas.description: Delicate leaves with sweet, floral aroma
green_teas.instructions: Add leaves to teapot, pour water over, steep for 2-3 minutes, produces clear, bright liquor

black_teas.name: English Breakfast
black_teas.description: Full-bodied blend perfect for morning, often with milk
black_teas.instructions: Boil water, add tea to teapot or infuser, pour boiling water over leaves, steep for 3-5 minutes, add milk and sugar to taste

black_teas.name: Earl Grey
black_teas.description: Black tea flavored with bergamot oil, citrusy and aromatic
black_teas.instructions: Add tea to teapot, pour boiling water over leaves, steep for 3-5 minutes, serve plain or with lemon, traditionally without milk

black_teas.name: Assam
black_teas.description: Malty, robust tea with deep color, excellent with milk
black_teas.instructions: Use boiling water for full extraction, steep for 3-5 minutes, strong enough to stand up to milk and sugar

black_teas.name: Darjeeling
black_teas.description: Champagne of teas, light and floral with muscatel notes
black_teas.instructions: Use slightly cooler water than other black teas, steep for 3-4 minutes, best enjoyed without milk to appreciate delicate flavor

black_teas.name: Ceylon
black_teas.description: Bright, brisk tea with citrus notes
black_teas.instructions: Add tea to teapot, pour boiling water over leaves, steep for 3-5 minutes, versatile tea good hot or iced

black_teas.name: Lapsang Souchong
black_teas.description: Smoked over pine fires, distinctive smoky flavor
black_teas.instructions: Add leaves to teapot, pour boiling water over, steep for 3-5 minutes, strong smoky flavor pairs well with savory foods

black_teas.name: Keemun
black_teas.description: Smooth, wine-like flavor with subtle smokiness
black_teas.instructions: Add leaves to teapot, pour hot water over, steep for 3-4 minutes, often used in English Breakfast blends

black_teas.name: Yunnan Gold (Dian Hong)
black_teas.description: Golden tips, sweet and malty with chocolate notes
black_teas.instructions: Add golden-tipped leaves to teapot, pour boiling water over, steep for 3-5 minutes, naturally sweet with no bitterness

black_teas.name: Irish Breakfast
black_teas.description: Stronger than English Breakfast, very robust
black_teas.instructions: Use boiling water, steep for 4-5 minutes for strong brew, traditionally served with generous milk and sugar

black_teas.name: Nilgiri
black_teas.description: Smooth, fragrant tea with bright flavor
black_teas.instructions: Add tea to teapot, pour boiling water over, steep for 3-5 minutes, excellent for iced tea

oolong_teas.name: Tie Guan Yin (Iron Goddess)
oolong_teas.description: Floral and creamy with orchid notes
oolong_teas.instructions: Rinse leaves with hot water briefly, discard rinse, add fresh hot water, steep for 2-3 minutes, can re-steep 5-7 times

oolong_teas.name: Da Hong Pao (Big Red Robe)
oolong_teas.description: Roasted oolong with mineral and chocolate notes
oolong_teas.instructions: Use gongfu brewing method for best results, rinse leaves, steep for short intervals, can re-steep many times

oolong_teas.name: Dong Ding
oolong_teas.description: Lightly roasted with fruity and floral notes
oolong_teas.instructions: Rinse leaves briefly, steep for 2-3 minutes, increases in complexity with each steeping

oolong_teas.name: Oriental Beauty (Bai Hao)
oolong_teas.description: Heavily oxidized with honey and fruit notes, naturally sweet
oolong_teas.instructions: Use lower temperature to preserve delicate flavors, steep for 2-3 minutes, naturally sweet from insect bites on leaves

oolong_teas.name: Milk Oolong (Jin Xuan)
oolong_teas.description: Creamy, buttery flavor with natural milky notes
oolong_teas.instructions: Rinse leaves briefly, steep for 2-3 minutes, naturally creamy without added milk or flavoring

oolong_teas.name: Phoenix Dan Cong
oolong_teas.description: Complex flavors ranging from floral to fruity to honey
oolong_teas.instructions: Use gongfu method, rinse leaves, steep for short intervals, each variety has unique flavor profile

oolong_teas.name: Alishan
oolong_teas.description: High mountain oolong, floral and buttery
oolong_teas.instructions: Rinse leaves briefly, steep for 2-3 minutes, high altitude gives it unique floral character

oolong_teas.name: Shui Xian (Water Sprite)
oolong_teas.description: Roasted oolong with orchid and stone fruit notes
oolong_teas.instructions: Rinse leaves with hot water, steep for 2-3 minutes, can re-steep multiple times

white_teas.name: Silver Needle (Bai Hao Yin Zhen)
white_teas.description: Most delicate white tea, made from unopened buds only
white_teas.instructions: Use cooler water to preserve delicate flavors, steep for 4-5 minutes, sweet and subtle with no bitterness

white_teas.name: White Peony (Bai Mu Dan)
white_teas.description: Buds and leaves, fuller flavor than Silver Needle
white_teas.instructions: Add leaves to teapot, pour hot water over, steep for 3-5 minutes, slightly stronger than Silver Needle

white_teas.name: Shou Mei (Long Life Eyebrow)
white_teas.description: Stronger white tea with more robust flavor
white_teas.instructions: Add leaves to teapot, pour hot water over, steep for 3-4 minutes, fuller body than other white teas

white_teas.name: Gong Mei (Tribute Eyebrow)
white_teas.description: Similar to Shou Mei but higher grade
white_teas.instructions: Add leaves to teapot, pour hot water over, steep for 3-4 minutes, slightly more refined than Shou Mei

white_teas.name: Moonlight White (Yue Guang Bai)
white_teas.description: Yunnan white tea with sweet, fruity notes
white_teas.instructions: Add leaves to teapot, pour hot water over, steep for 3-5 minutes, unique flavor profile from Yunnan terroir

pu_erh_teas.name: Sheng (Raw) Pu-erh
pu_erh_teas.description: Unfermented, ages over time, earthy and complex
pu_erh_teas.instructions: Break off piece from cake, rinse leaves twice with hot water, steep for short intervals using gongfu method, can re-steep 10+ times

pu_erh_teas.name: Shou (Ripe) Pu-erh
pu_erh_teas.description: Fermented, smooth and earthy with no astringency
pu_erh_teas.instructions: Break off piece from cake, rinse leaves twice with boiling water, steep for short intervals, smooth and mellow flavor

pu_erh_teas.name: Aged Pu-erh
pu_erh_teas.description: Vintage pu-erh aged 10+ years, complex and smooth
pu_erh_teas.instructions: Break off piece carefully, rinse leaves, steep for short intervals, flavor improves with age like fine wine

pu_erh_teas.name: Mini Tuo Cha
pu_erh_teas.description: Small compressed pu-erh nests, convenient single serving
pu_erh_teas.instructions: Place entire tuo cha in teapot, rinse with hot water, steep for 2-3 minutes, can re-steep multiple times

herbal_teas.name: Chamomile
herbal_teas.instructions: Add chamomile flowers to teapot, pour boiling water over, steep for 5-7 minutes, strain and add honey if desired

herbal_teas.name: Peppermint
herbal_teas.instructions: Add peppermint leaves to teapot, pour boiling water over, steep for 5-7 minutes, naturally sweet and refreshing

herbal_teas.name: Rooibos (Red Bush)
herbal_teas.instructions: Add rooibos to teapot, pour boiling water over, steep for 5-7 minutes, can be enjoyed with milk like black tea

herbal_teas.name: Hibiscus
herbal_teas.description: Tart and fruity, deep red color, high in vitamin C
herbal_teas.instructions: Add hibiscus flowers to teapot, pour boiling water over, steep for 5-7 minutes, naturally tart so sweeten to taste

herbal_teas.name: Ginger
herbal_teas.description: Spicy and warming, aids digestion and nausea
herbal_teas.instructions: Slice fresh ginger thinly, add to pot with water, bring to boil and simmer for 10-15 minutes, strain and add honey and lemon

herbal_teas.name: Lavender
herbal_teas.instructions: Add lavender buds to teapot, pour boiling water over, steep for 5-7 minutes, strain well and sweeten if desired

herbal_teas.name: Lemon Balm
herbal_teas.instructions: Add lemon balm to teapot, pour boiling water over, steep for 5-7 minutes, naturally lemony without added citrus

herbal_teas.name: Nettle
herbal_teas.instructions: Add nettle leaves to teapot, pour boiling water over, steep for 5-10 minutes, high in vitamins and minerals

herbal_teas.name: Tulsi (Holy Basil)
herbal_teas.description: Adaptogenic herb, spicy and slightly sweet
herbal_teas.instructions: Add tulsi to teapot, pour boiling water over, steep for 5-7 minutes, revered in Ayurvedic medicine

herbal_teas.name: Yerba Mate
herbal_teas.instructions: Use cooler water to avoid bitterness, add mate to gourd or teapot, pour water over, steep for 3-5 minutes, can re-steep

specialty_blends.name: Masala Chai
specialty_blends.description: Spiced black tea with milk and sweetener
ingredients: spices: cardamom, cinnamon, ginger, cloves, black pepper
specialty_blends.instructions: Crush spices and add to pot with water, bring to boil, add tea and simmer 3-5 minutes, add milk and sugar, bring to boil again, strain and serve hot

specialty_blends.name: Moroccan Mint Tea
specialty_blends.description: Sweet green tea with fresh mint
specialty_blends.instructions: Rinse tea leaves with hot water, add fresh hot water, mint, and sugar, steep for 3-5 minutes, pour from height to create foam

specialty_blends.name: London Fog
specialty_blends.instructions: Steep Earl Grey in hot water for 3-5 minutes, strain, add vanilla syrup, steam milk and pour over tea

specialty_blends.name: Thai Iced Tea
specialty_blends.instructions: Steep Thai tea in boiling water for 3-5 minutes, strain, add sugar while hot, let cool, pour over ice, top with condensed milk

specialty_blends.name: Russian Caravan
specialty_blends.description: Smoky blend of oolong, keemun, and lapsang souchong
specialty_blends.instructions: Add tea to teapot, pour hot water over, steep for 3-5 minutes, traditionally served with lemon and sugar

specialty_blends.name: Bubble Tea (Boba)
specialty_blends.instructions: Brew strong black tea, add sugar while hot, let cool, cook tapioca pearls, add pearls to glass, add ice, pour tea and milk over
